DarkHawk/Hydras/Perceptor:


Hydras, Darkhawk and Perceptor arrived at the =
area  and opened fire against Tucson and Ratrap. Some fo the Spiders-bots w=
ere destroyed while the rest  started to perform repairs 




From: Sandy 
=
Sent: Sunday, February 28, 2010 12:16 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subjec=
t: Re: Recovering Rodimus/BlackFortress


  
Quickstride gets the shuttle a=
irbourne and sets the course for the tower. He tries to lock in on an Autob=
ot signature, and gets Rat Trap's readilly.

"Sir, I've locked in on Rat Tr=
ap's signature.... And yes, I do see a faint but very faint Autobot signatu=
re... It's a bit weaker than normal... Which Oh wow, sir, that Autobot seem=
s to be using a backup battery... Not good... Because when he loses that he=
's done for."

Back at the fortress, Rat Trap scrambles to try to evade the=
 fire, and now realizes that things are far out of hand. He finds himself f=
lushed out of his hiding place, and cornered at the entrance of the vent co=
ver.

"Gahhh! So much for evasive maneuvers! RAT TRAP MAXIMIZE!"

He gets i=
nto robot mode and slides down, landing behind Tucson. Tucson turns his hea=
d after hearing him land on his tiny feet.

"Rat Trap?"

Rat Trap looks up.=


"Sorry Wheels, cover got blown. The pipes are crawln' with spider bots an=
d the base's defenses are on high alert. I managed ta kinda do some damage =
to the electrical system but not much. Oh slag... I - see why you're not mo=
vn'."

He looks up to Rodimus.

Tucson stands idol and then realizes that h=
is backup battery is being drained rather quickly. He could also hear Darkh=
awk behind him.

"I'm down to eighty percent in my backup battery, not enou=
gh to fight, just enough for an escape, Rodimus is blocking my way and that=
 pest of a predicon is beginning to really annoy me."

Rat Trap desperately=
 open fires on the auto guns and droids.

"So what's the plan wheels?!"

Tu=
cson sighs he would have to abandon his plight for the time being. Somethin=
g inside him was telling him that his escape now was more important than tr=
ying to do everything at one time. 

"Sometimes Rat Trap, we don't always h=
ave the answers to everything. And right now, I have no answer for you. I w=
ant you to get yourself out of here.. Now."

Rat Trap gasps. He gives Tucso=
n back the transmitter.

"But, but what about you wheels? I can't leave ya =
here, he'll pulverize ya. You're just about the only pal I got left and I c=
an't afford ta lose ya!"

Tucson stays put.

" Please, go! NOW! FOR YOUR SA=
FTEY RAT TRAP, GET OUT OF HERE!"

Rat Trap doesn't budge.

"NO, IF YOU GO D=
OWN I GO WITH YA! I AIN'T GONNA ABANDON YA WHEELS, YOU DIDN'T ABANDON ME SO=
 IT'S HIGH TIME I RETURN THE FAVOR!"

He didn't know how to react. Rat Trap=
 may be small but his heart was definitely in the right place. If anything =
was going to help the both of them, it was this newly found friendship that=
 they developed in just a short amount of time. He gently puts a hand on Ra=
t Trap's head, and gives it a gentile rub.

" Guess there's no changing you=
r mind is there?"

Rat Trap smiles up to him.

"We're in this tagether Whee=
ls." 

Tucson's expression changes as he now turns his attention to Rodimus=
.

" You mock us because you think we're inferior. I beg to differ with you=
 Rodimus. Because if you were as strong as you claim to be, you would not h=
ave fallen into such treachery. There's something about this room you remem=
ber, it will always haunt you and not because of the pain it may have cause=
d, but the guilt you will always feel, knowing that you did not have the wi=
ll to fend off your enemy when they overtook you. I did look up to you at o=
ne time, I thought you were strong, resistant, and noble. My views have all=
 been altered now. I do not know what happened, perhaps one day I will unde=
rstand, but now, I see the truth. Truth is, you don't want to be helped, an=
d you have turned your back on your faction. Truth is, the only true leader=
 of the Autobots was Optimus Prime. I'd do anything to see him back online =
once again. You are not my leader anymore and you do not intimidate me. If =
I fall I fall, but at least I know I did my best to honor Optimus Prime as =
he would have wanted me to. No scrappling would ever have pledged his loyal=
ty as Rat Trap has today. His heart is there, and it's more than I can say =
for you."

Rat Trap freezes for a moment. He had not expected Tucson to say=
 what he said.

"Wow, wheels ya really mean that?"

Tucson nodds.

"I do."
=

His expression turns stone cold.

" I intend to finish what I started, I w=
ill finish my mission, but after that, do not expect me to have the same am=
ount of respect for you when this is all over Rodimus. But now, is not the =
time for that. I see that what I accomplished was just the first phase. I'v=
e accomplished that thus far. I've learned for myself what needs to be done=
, and what needs to be done can't be completed today. That will have to wai=
t."

Rat Trap looks up.

"Wheels we gotta move."

Tucson listens to Rat Tra=
p and transforms in front of Rodimus. He opens his driver's side door and l=
ets him in.

" I believe this is where you step asside Rodimus, and let us =
pass."

He exclaims while shotting at a few more droids.

--- In nbwrpg@yah=
oogroups.com, <airly2002@...> wrote:

> Perceptor/DarkHawk/swarm bots:
> 
=
> Perceptor Started to track furios the maximals and Autobot's signature wh=
ile the inner defences started to pop out and opening fire against Tucson. =
The inner Alarms was ranging aloud and Hydras ran towars the level where Tu=
cson and ratrap were.
> 
> the swarmbots started to opened their mini laser=
s agaisnt Ratrap, while Darkhawk, furious for what had happened, he ran beh=
ind Tucson
> 
> 
> 
> 
> From: Sandy 
> Sent: Friday, February 26, 2010 10:=
58 AM
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
> Subject: Re: Recovering Rodimus/Black=
Fortress
> 
> 
> 
> On wheels, Tucson had a better chance of maneuvering be=
tween the blasts that Scorponok was throwing out. He uses his current state=
 to his advantage, and screches his rubber on his tires, pivoting them quic=
kly to maneuver away from the blasts. He had no sonar senses to guide him b=
ut he had his audo sensors and his sense of feel and touch, guiding him. Th=
e system that Rat Trap was now holding merely augments his audio sensors an=
d even though he could have used the device, he was now quickly getting use=
d to not having it on him. And now, he could feel Rodimus's energy signatur=
e. But first he had to get rid of Scorponok and Dark Hawk. He knew he did n=
ot have enough energon in his main power core, but he did have a reserve st=
ash in his backup battery. He calculated that since he had hardly touched t=
his backup, it had close to ninety five percent capacity, yet it had to be =
used sparingly. This meant deciding between vehicle and robot mode. He make=
s a quick anaylasis of his systems.. Which would be able to concerve more? =
Vehicle or robot mode? 
> 
> The truth was, they were equal in ussage. But =
he knew he had to stick to vehicle mode, to make for a fast getaway if he d=
id indeed find a way out of there.. Meanwhile, hidden not too far now, from=
 the torture chamber, Rat Trap who has made his way into a vent hole, right=
 over the chamber, spots Tucson. He then finds another bundle of wires and =
finds readable tags on them.
> 
> "It's wheels, he's up'n runn'n.. Must be =
on a backup battery... That might last a few hours but that's about it. Oka=
y, time for this rat ta be his rattiest!" 
> 
> He finds a tag that leads t=
o the chamber, and begins to knaw at the wires that are connected to it. He=
 snaps them readilly with his strong, buck teeth. The doors suddenly open i=
n the torture chamber.
> 
> "WHEELS, BURN RUBBER!"
> 
> Tucson could hear R=
at Trap's voice and without questioning him, he spins his rear tires, creat=
es a smoke screen and senses the wind coming in from the open doors. He tak=
es this opportunity to get past Scorponok, via creating a low lying smoke c=
loud, cloaking his chassse, and manges to get outside the chamber, stopping=
 in front of Rodimus. Rat Trap continues to knaw at wires, hoping that one =
of them was another wire that would disable the security and weaponry syste=
ms.
> 
> Outside, Tucson transforms into robot mode and in front of Rodimus=
. This was it,he was face to face with his former leader. Rat Trap position=
s himself inside, at a peek hole, to watch what's happening.
> 
> "Lord Eld=
er, you wont' believe this, but, Tucson got outa there, and he's face ta fa=
ce with Rodimus. I sure hope he gives 'em his come uppn's. Lousey worthless=
 piece of Scrap.. I hope wheels drives you to the ground'n then some... "
>=
 
> At the Ark and shuttle area...
> 
> Quickstride looks around and focuse=
s on the shuttle. Yet, the body of Optimus Prime holds his attention for a =
moment as he looks up to him.
> 
> "Wow, you must've been one heck of a lea=
der in your days. Rat Trap says he's with someone who's related to you. I w=
ish I could do something ta help you guys get back on your wheels, but I'm =
just a Maximal and I really don't know how to bring your men back ta life..=
. That Autobot out there could sure use your help, looks like that Rodimus =
guy really let you down and gave into those Predacons. I really can't judge=
 the guy because I wasn't there when it happened, but from what Rat Trap sa=
ys, I - dunno if I could ever respect a leader who weakens under pressure. =
Okay, I gotta go, Lord Elder needs my help. Rest in peace.
> 
> He salutes =
the still form of Optimus Prime and gets to the shuttle. 
> 
> "Lord Elder,=
 I've reached the shuttle and I'm now performing preliminary take off proce=
edures."
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus=
@> wrote:
> >
> > Rodimus had been standing just outside the torture chambe=
r not sure if
> > he wanted to actually enter it. there was something about=
 this room
> > that gave him the chills, especially when he didn't need to =
go in
> > there.
> > 
> > Instead he just stood in the shadows, listening t=
he words of the
> > others like Darkhawk, Scorponok and that Autobot Tuscon=
. there was
> > something about that Autobot that seemed to grate on his ne=
rves. He
> > wasn't sure what it was, maybe it was his high sounding talk, =
maybe it
> > was his tenacity, maybe it was his . . . .
> > 
> > *SLAM!*
> =
> 
> > Rodimus was jolted out of his revelry by the doors slamming shut,
> =
> cutting him off from the torture chamber. Inside he could hear
> > threat=
ening tones coming from Scorponok and Darkhawk, and the sound of
> > a vehi=
cle's engine revving.
> > 
> > Rodimus' attention was diverted from further=
 listening as a message
> > came over his comms, a text message from Percep=
tor.
> > 
> > > "Rodimus... Go to this sector and watch out that our enemie=
s doesnt go inside" typed Perceptor fast and send the secret message "They =
mustnt get her... Do what ever you have to to stop them"
> > 
> > "Yes!" Ro=
dimus jumped as he could see the urgency with the speed that
> > Perceptor =
was typing the message. "On my way!" he sent back as he
> > received the lo=
cation from Perceptor.
> > 
> > Rodimus was surprised, as the location was =
only a short distance away.
> > With a thought he quickly shifted into his =
vehicle, gunned his motor
> > and moved swiftly. He figured the 'her' that =
Perceptor was referring
> > to was Nightlight. Nightlight was Rodimus' wife=
, he would not let
> > those idiot Maximals get their hands on her!
> > 
> =
> (TAG)
> > 
> > Preston
> > (Dark Rodimus)
> >
>
